contextId.information: Paul speaks of God's message as if it were an object that could be visibly shown to people. AT: "He proclaimed his word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Though Titus was not Paul's biological son, they share a common faith in Christ. Thus, in Christ, Paul considers Titus as his own son. AT: "you are like a son to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of the church as if it were God's household and the overseer as if he were a servant in charge of managing the household. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of devotion to the Christian faith as if it were grasping the faith with one's hands. AT: "be devoted to" or "know well"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of the truth as if it were an object in motion that could be turned back in the direction from where it came. AT: "reject the truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of sinners as if they were physically dirty. AT: "the one who is morally defiled and who does not believe cannot be pure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: to those who are stained and unbelieving, nothing is pure

contextId.information: A person who habitually feels the need to drink alcoholic beverages usually drinks them in great amounts. Paul speaks of addicted persons as if they were slaves. AT: "addicted to wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of Christian teaching as if it were an object that could be decorated. AT: "make our teaching attractive to other people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of Jesus as if he were setting slaves free from their evil master. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: to redeem us from all lawlessness

contextId.information: Paul is probably speaking of God's forgiveness for sinners as if he were physically washing them. He is also speaking of sinners who become responsive to God as if they had been born again. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

It is common for New Testament writers to speak of the Holy Spirit as of a liquid that could be poured. AT: "gave the Holy Spirit to us generously" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:bita_phenom]])
contextId.quote: poured the Holy Spirit on us

contextId.information: The people to whom God has made promises are spoken of as if they were to inherit property and wealth from a family member. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: we might become heirs through the confidence of eternal life

contextId.information: Paul speaks about good deeds as if they were objects that God could place in front of people. AT: "that God prepared for them to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of someone who makes errors as if he were leaving the path on which he had been walking (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: has turned from the right way

contextId.information: Paul speaks of good result as if they were fruit. AT: "so they will produce good results" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: so that they may not be unfruitful
